viewers.py A Module to View¶

viewers.tri_plot(x, y, topo)¶

This is a super simple function to plot a triangular mesh. It is also an interesting exercize to see how to loop over the mesh elementzs. x and y are one dimensional arrays containg the nodes coordinates. On each row of the topo matrix is stored the dof (degree of freedom) with support on the row-th element. Notice that we are looping over the first dimension of topo, so we only need to write a standard python for loop:

for row in topo:

The numpy command hstack is used to attach the last node to the first one. This is done to “close” our triangles.

row = np.hstack([row,row[0]])

We use the [ ] brackets to acces the nodes and define the local coords.

x_l = x[row]
y_l = y[row]

Now we only need to plot the local coords for every triangle:

plt.plot(x_l, y_l,'-b',linewidth=2)
